document_data.name: Giant Sea Anemone
document_data.skincolor: Blue, Green, Pink, Red, or some combination
document_data.mainbody: '''Giant sea anemones''' were a monstrous species of the [[anemone|creatures of the same name]], which many mistook for plants.
document_data.Description:
These creatures had a stout central body that was {{SI|8|ft|long=yes}} in diameter and crowned with a gaping maw that was {{SI|6|ft|long=yes}} in diameter. Surrounding their mouths were a number of tentacles, with the average amount being around a hundred. Each tentacle was covered in hundreds of small, barbed, hook-like needles that would spring forth once a prey was in their grasp.

Anemones had very colorful bodies that displayed colors of blue, green, pink, orange, purple, or some combination of them.
document_data.Behavior: These creatures possessed no form of higher intelligence, having intellects below that of most animals.
document_data.Abilities:
The barbed hooks that covered the tentacles of anemones would inject prey with a paralytic [[poison]], which could be negated with the [[spell]] ''[[neutralize poison]]''. So long as a tentacle was attached to a creature, the poison would continue to advance.

Any tentacle that was severed from an anemone's body would regrow at a rate of {{SI|1|ft|long=yes}} per day. The base of the creature however, could not regenerate.
document_data.Combat:
The tentacles of anemones would very swiftly ensnared any creatures that came within {{SI|30|ft|long=yes}} of them and draw the prey towards their maw. Anemones typically would attempt to attach at least three tentacles to their prey. If a prey was inedible or too large, it would release them once they became paralyzed. If an anemone was full, then it would simply hold on to its prey for later.

When seriously threatened a giant sea anemone would draw their tentacles all the way back into their central body.

Species.Chest Anemone: a variety of giant sea anemones that were specially cultivated by the [[storm giant]]s of [[Maelstrom (fortress)|Maelstrom]]. They were around {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}} tall and {{SI|10|ft|long=yes}} wide. Unlike other species, these anemones were capable of surviving out of water and had hollow cavities within them. They were used by storm giants as both treasure chests and waste disposal systems.

Ecology.Diet: Giant sea anemones were a carnivorous species.
Ecology.Relationships:
Some creatures were unaffected by the paralytic poison of giant sea anemones, either from being immune to it or from having thick hides. This included certain brightly colored fish,{{Cite dragon/250/Dragon's Bestiary: Aquatic Creatures|88}} which would hide inside them from predators and feed on the scraps they left behind. And [[barracuda]]s, who preyed upon their tentacles.

Some aquatic races kept giant sea anemones as guard animals, fighting them just enough to keep them from wandering away.
